params.description: the selector string or function filter passed to Y.delegate(...) (not present when called from Y.on(...))

params.name: node
params.description: the node the subscription is being applied to

params.name: sub
params.description: the object to track this subscription

params.name: notifier
params.description:
call notifier.fire(..) to
trigger the execution of the subscribers

params.name: filter
params.description:
Selector string or function that
accepts an event object and returns null, a Node, or an
array of Nodes matching the criteria for processing.

delegate.description:
Implementers SHOULD provide this method definition.

Implementation logic for subscriptions done via node.delegate(type, fn, filter) or Y.delegate(type, fn, container, filter). Like with on() above, this function should monitor the environment for the event being fired, and trigger subscription execution by calling notifier.fire(e).

This function receives a fourth argument, which is the filter used to identify which Node's are of interest to the subscription. The filter will be either a boolean function that accepts a target Node for each hierarchy level as the event bubbles, or a selector string. To translate selector strings into filter functions, use Y.delegate.compileFilter(filter).

params.name: extra
params.description: Any extra data extracted from processArgs

params.name: sub
params.description: the individual subscription

applyArgExtras.description:
Implementers MAY provide this method definition.

Implement this function if you want extra data extracted during processArgs to be propagated to subscriptions on a per-node basis. That is to say, if you call Y.on('xyz', fn, xtra, 'div') the data returned from processArgs will be shared across the subscription objects for all the divs. If you want each subscription to receive unique information, do that processing here.

The default implementation adds the data extracted by processArgs to the subscription object as sub._extra.

params.name: args
params.description: parmeters passed to Y.on(..) or Y.delegate(..)

params.name: delegate
params.description: true if the subscription is from Y.delegate

processArgs.description:
Implementers MAY provide this method definition.

Implement this function if the event supports a different subscription signature. This function is used by both on() and delegate(). The second parameter indicates that the event is being subscribed via delegate().

Implementations must remove extra arguments from the args list before returning. The required args for on() subscriptions are

[type, callback, target, context, argN...]

The required args for delegate() subscriptions are

[type, callback, target, filter, context, argN...]

The return value from this function will be stored on the subscription in the '_extra' property for reference elsewhere.

_detach.description: Removes the subscription(s) from the internal subscription dispatch mechanism. See SyntheticEvent._deleteSub.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments passed to node.detach(...)

_deleteSub.description: Alternate _delete() method for the CustomEvent object created to manage SyntheticEvent subscriptions.

params.name: sub

params.name: sub
params.description: the object tracking this subscription

params.name: notifier
params.description:
the Notifier used to
trigger the execution of the subscribers

detach.description:
Implementers SHOULD provide this method definition.

Implementation logic for detaching subscriptions done via node.on(type, fn). This function should clean up any subscriptions made in the on() phase.

return.description: detach handles for the matching subscriptions

params.name: node
params.description: the node hosting the event

params.name: args
params.description: the array of original subscription args passed to Y.on(...) (before processArgs

params.description:
function used to identify a subscription
for inclusion in the returned array

params.description:
stop after the first match (used to check for
duplicate subscriptions)

getSubs.description: Returns the detach handles of subscriptions on a node that satisfy a search/filter function. By default, the filter used is the subMatch method.

preventDups.description:
Implementers MAY override this property.

Whether to prevent multiple subscriptions to this event that are classified as being the same. By default, this means the subscribed callback is the same function. See the subMatch method. Setting this to true will impact performance for high volume events.

These arguments will be added after the event object.

delegate.description:
Sets up a delegation listener for an event occurring inside the Node. The delegated event will be verified against a supplied selector or filtering function to test if the event references at least one node that should trigger the subscription callback.

Selector string filters will trigger the callback if the event originated from a node that matches it or is contained in a node that matches it. Function filters are called for each Node up the parent axis to the subscribing container node, and receive at each level the Node and the event object. The function should return true (or a truthy value) if that Node should trigger the subscription callback. Note, it is possible for filters to match multiple Nodes for a single event. In this case, the delegate callback will be executed for each matching Node.

For each matching Node, the callback will be executed with its 'this' object set to the Node matched by the filter (unless a specific context was provided during subscription), and the provided event's currentTarget will also be set to the matching Node. The containing Node from which the subscription was originally made can be referenced as e.container.

return.description: Depends on what is returned from the DOM node.

scrubVal.description:
Checks Node return values and wraps DOM Nodes as Y.Node instances
and DOM Collections / Arrays as Y.NodeList instances.
Other return values just pass thru.  If undefined is returned (e.g. no return)
then the Node instance is returned for chainability.

attributes/properties for the node will be set.

If the "transition" module is loaded, hide optionally
animates the hiding of the node using either the default
transition effect ('fadeOut'), or the given named effect.

The name of the field to clear. If no name

duration: 1, // in seconds, default is 0.5

duration: 2,
delay: 2,
easing: 'ease-in'
}
});

Test.Runner.name: Test.Runner

testcasebegin.description:
Fires when a test case is opened but before the first 
test is executed.

testcasecomplete.description: Fires when all tests in a test case have been executed.

begin.description: Fires when the run() method is called.

ignore.description: Fires when a test has been ignored.

testsuitebegin.description:
Fires when a test suite is opened but before the first 
test is executed.

testsuitecomplete.description:
Fires when all test cases in a test suite have been
completed.

pass.description: Fires when a test has passed.

fail.description: Fires when a test has failed.

complete.description: Fires when all test suites and test cases have been completed.

disableLogging.description:
Disable logging via Y.log(). Test output will not be visible unless
TestRunner events are subscribed to.

return.description: Results of the execution with properties passed, failed, and total.

_run.description: Runs a test case or test suite, returning the results.

params.name: testObject
params.description: The test case or test suite to run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is running, false if not.

isRunning.description:
Indicates that the TestRunner is busy running tests and therefore can't
be stopped and results cannot be gathered.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the result set.

setName.description:
The name assigned to the master suite of the TestRunner. This is the name
that is output as the root's name when results are retrieved.

return.description:
Either the coverage object or, if a coverage
format is specified, a string representing the results in that format.

params.name: format
params.description: (Optional) A coverage format to return results in.

getCoverage.description:
Returns the coverage report for the files that have been executed.
This returns only coverage information for files that have been
instrumented using YUI Test Coverage and only those that were run
in the same pass.

params.name: event
params.description: The event object for the event.

params.description: The node to add the test case to as a child.

params.name: testCase
params.description: The test case to add.

return.description: The name of the result set.

resume.description: Resumes the TestRunner after wait() was called.

params.name: segment
params.description:
The function to run as the rest
of the haulted test.

return.description:
Either the results object or, if a test format is 
passed as the argument, a string representing the results in a specific
format.

params.name: format
params.description: (Optional) A test format to return the results in.

getResults.description:
Returns the last complete results set from the TestRunner. Null is returned
if the TestRunner is running or no tests have been run.

enableLogging.description:
Enable logging via Y.log(). Test output is published and can be read via
logreader.

_buildTestTree.description:
Builds the test tree based on items in the master suite. The tree is a hierarchical
representation of the test suites, test cases, and test functions. The resulting tree
is stored in _root and the pointer _cur is set to the root initially.

_addTestSuiteToTestTree.description: Adds a test suite to the test tree as a child of the specified node.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to add the test suite to as a child.

params.name: testSuite
params.description: The test suite to add.

_handleTestObjectComplete.description:
Handles the completion of a test object's tests. Tallies test results 
from one level up to the next.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test object.

add.description: Adds a test suite or test case to the list of test objects to run.

params.name: testObject
params.description: Either a TestCase or a TestSuite that should be run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is waiting, false if not.

isWaiting.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting for a test to resume

return.description: The next node in the test tree or null if the end is reached.

_next.description: Retrieves the next node in the test tree.

params.name: oldMode
params.description:
(Optional) Specifies that the <= 2.8 way of
internally managing test suites should be used.

_handleError.description:
Handles an error as if it occurred within the currently executing
test. This is for mock methods that may be called asynchronously
and therefore out of the scope of the TestRunner. Previously, this
error would bubble up to the browser. Now, this method is used
to tell TestRunner about the error. This should never be called
by anyplace other than the Mock object.

params.name: error
params.description: The error object.

clear.description: Removes all test objects from the runner.

_runTest.description: Runs a single test based on the data provided in the node.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test to run.

_runTest.name: _runTest

_running.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is currently running tests.

_root.description: Pointer to the root node in the test tree.

masterSuite.description: Suite on which to attach all TestSuites and TestCases to be run.

_log.description: Indicates if the TestRunner will log events or not.

_waiting.description:
Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting as a result of
wait() being called.

_cur.description: Pointer to the current node in the test tree.

_lastResults.description:
Holds copy of the results object generated when all tests are
complete.

Test.Runner.description:
Runs test suites and test cases, providing events to allowing for the
interpretation of test results.

script.description:
Fetches and inserts one or more script nodes into the head
of the current document or the document in a specified window.

params.name: url
params.description: the url or urls to the script(s).

params.name: opts
params.description:
Options:
onSuccess
callback to execute when the script(s) are finished loading The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onTimeout
callback to execute when a timeout occurs. The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onEnd
a function that executes when the transaction finishes, regardless of the exit path
onFailure
callback to execute when the script load operation fails The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted successfully
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove any nodes that were inserted
context
the execution context for the callbacks
win
a window other than the one the utility occupies
autopurge
setting to true will let the utilities cleanup routine purge the script once loaded
purgethreshold
The number of transaction before autopurge should be initiated
data
data that is supplied to the callback when the script(s) are loaded.
insertBefore
node or node id that will become the new node's nextSibling. If this is not specified, nodes will be inserted before a base tag should it exist. Otherwise, the nodes will be appended to the end of the document head.
charset
Node charset, default utf-8 (deprecated, use the attributes config)
attributes
An object literal containing additional attributes to add to the link tags
timeout
Number of milliseconds to wait before aborting and firing the timeout event
  Y.Get.script(
  ["http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/yahoo/yahoo-min.js",
   "http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/event/event-min.js"],
  {
    onSuccess: function(o) {
      this.log("won't cause error because Y is the context");
      Y.log(o.data); // foo
      Y.log(o.nodes.length === 2) // true
      // o.purge(); // optionally remove the script nodes
                    // immediately
    },
    onFailure: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction failed");
    },
    onTimeout: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction timed out");
    },
    data: "foo",
    timeout: 10000, // 10 second timeout
    context: Y, // make the YUI instance
    // win: otherframe // target another window/frame
    autopurge: true // allow the utility to choose when to
                    // remove the nodes
    purgetheshold: 1 // purge previous transaction before
                     // next transaction
  });.

JSON.name: JSON

return.description: the native JavaScript representation of the JSON string

params.name: s
params.description: JSON string data

params.name: reviver
params.description:
(optional) function(k,v) passed each key value
pair of object literals, allowing pruning or altering values

parse.description: Parse a JSON string, returning the native JavaScript representation.

return.description: JSON string representation of the input

stringify.description:
Converts an arbitrary value to a JSON string representation.

Objects with cyclical references will trigger an exception.

If a whitelist is provided, only matching object keys will be included. Alternately, a replacer function may be passed as the second parameter. This function is executed on every value in the input, and its return value will be used in place of the original value. This is useful to serialize specialized objects or class instances.

If a positive integer or non-empty string is passed as the third parameter, the output will be formatted with carriage returns and indentation for readability. If a String is passed (such as "\t") it will be used once for each indentation level. If a number is passed, that number of spaces will be used.

params.name: o
params.description: any arbitrary value to convert to JSON string

params.name: w
params.description:
(optional) whitelist of acceptable object
keys to include, or a replacer function to modify the
raw value before serialization

params.name: ind
params.description:
(optional) indentation character or depth of
spaces to format the output.

return.description: the \unnnn escapement of the character

escapeException.description:
Replaces specific unicode characters with their appropriate \unnnn
format. Some browsers ignore certain characters during eval.

params.name: c
params.description: Unicode character

return.description: stringified Date in UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ

dateToString.description:
Serializes a Date instance as a UTC date string.  Used internally by
stringify.  Override this method if you need Dates serialized in a
different format.

params.name: d
params.description: The Date to serialize

return.description: The results of the filtered data

_revive.description:
Traverses nested objects, applying a reviver function to each (key,value)
from the scope if the key:value's containing object.  The value returned
from the function will replace the original value in the key:value pair.
If the value returned is undefined, the key will be omitted from the
returned object.

params.name: data
params.description: Any JavaScript data

params.name: reviver
params.description: filter or mutation function

_BRACKETS.description:
Third step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to remove all open
square brackets following a colon, comma, or at the beginning of the
string.

_UNICODE_EXCEPTIONS.description:
Replace certain Unicode characters that JavaScript may handle incorrectly
during eval--either by deleting them or treating them as line
endings--with escape sequences.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This regex will be used to modify the input if a match is
found.

useNativeParse.description:
Leverage native JSON parse if the browser has a native implementation.
In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues section in the
JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true for browsers with
native JSON support.

JSON.useNativeStringify.description:
Leverage native JSON stringify if the browser has a native
implementation.  In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues
section in the JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true
for browsers with native JSON support.

_UNSAFE.description:
Final step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to test the string left
after all previous replacements for invalid characters.

_ESCAPES.description:
First step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all escape
sequences (i.e. "\\", etc) with '@' characters (a non-JSON character).

_VALUES.description:
Second step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all simple
values with ']' characters.

Native.description: Alias to native browser implementation of the JSON object if available.

JSON.description:
The JSON module adds support for serializing JavaScript objects into JSON strings and parsing JavaScript objects from strings in JSON format.

The JSON namespace is added to your YUI instance including static methods Y.JSON.parse(..) and Y.JSON.stringify(..).

The functionality and method signatures follow the ECMAScript 5 specification. In browsers with native JSON support, the native implementation is used.

The json module is a rollup of json-parse and json-stringify.

As their names suggest, json-parse adds support for parsing JSON data (Y.JSON.parse) and json-stringify for serializing JavaScript data into JSON strings (Y.JSON.stringify). You may choose to include either of the submodules individually if you don't need the complementary functionality, or include the rollup for both.

aggregated test results.

the name of the
page that was loaded, and the test suite results

within the test page itself to notify the TestManager that it is ready.

_run.description: Loads the next test page into the iframe.

params.description: An array of URLs to load.

Processes the results of a test page run, outputting log messages
for failed tests.

Handles TestRunner.COMPLETE_EVENT, storing the results and beginning
the loop again.

return.description: The created cookie string.

params.description: The value to set.

params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: path (a string), domain (a string), expires (a Date object),

params.description: The cookie hash string to parse (format: n1=v1&n2=v2).

return.description: The created cookie string.

set.description: Sets a cookie with a given name and value.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to set.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set for the cookie.

params.name: options
params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: path (a string), domain (a string), expires (a Date object),
secure (true/false), and raw (true/false). Setting raw to true indicates
that the cookie should not be URI encoded before being set.

return.description: The created cookie string.

setSubs.description: Sets a cookie with a given name to contain a hash of name-value pairs.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to set.

params.name: value
params.description: An object containing name-value pairs.

params.name: options
params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: path (a string), domain (a string), expires (a Date object),
and secure (true/false).

return.description: True if the cookie exists, false if not.

exists.description:
Determines if the cookie with the given name exists. This is useful for
Boolean cookies (those that do not follow the name=value convention).

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to check.

return.description:
If no converter is specified, returns a string or null if
the cookie doesn't exist. If the converter is specified, returns the value
returned from the converter or null if the cookie doesn't exist.

get.description: Returns the cookie value for the given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

params.name: options
params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: raw (true/false) and converter (a function).
The converter function is run on the value before returning it. The
function is not used if the cookie doesn't exist. The function can be
passed instead of the options object for backwards compatibility. When
raw is set to true, the cookie value is not URI decoded.

return.description: An object containing entries for each accessible cookie.

_parseCookieString.description: Parses a cookie string into an object representing all accessible cookies.

params.name: text
params.description: The cookie string to parse.

params.name: shouldDecode
params.description: (Optional) Indicates if the cookie values should be decoded or not. Default is true.

_setDoc.description: Sets the document object that the cookie utility uses for setting cookies. This method is necessary to ensure that the cookie utility unit tests can pass even when run on a domain instead of locally. This method should not be used otherwise; you should use Y.config.doc to change the document that the cookie utility uses for everyday purposes.

params.name: newDoc
params.description: The object to use as the document.

return.description: The created cookie string.

remove.description:
Removes a cookie from the machine by setting its expiration date to
sometime in the past.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to remove.

params.name: options
params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: path (a string), domain (a string), 
and secure (true/false). The expires option will be overwritten
by the method.

return.description: The created cookie string.

removeSub.description: Removes a sub cookie with a given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie in which the subcookie exists.

params.name: subName
params.description: The name of the subcookie to remove.

params.name: options
params.description:
(Optional) An object containing one or more
cookie options: path (a string), domain (a string), expires (a Date object),
removeIfEmpty (true/false), and secure (true/false). This must be the same
settings as the original subcookie.

return.description: A string suitable for use as a cookie value.

_createCookieHashString.description: Formats a cookie value for an object containing multiple values.

params.name: hash
params.description: An object of key-value pairs to create a string for.

return.description:
An object of name-value pairs if the cookie with the given name
exists, null if it does not.

getSubs.description: Returns an object containing name-value pairs stored in the cookie with the given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

return.description:
If the cookie doesn't exist, null is returned. If the subcookie
doesn't exist, null if also returned. If no converter is specified and the
subcookie exists, a string is returned. If a converter is specified and the
subcookie exists, the value returned from the converter is returned.

getSub.description: Returns the value of a subcookie.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

params.name: subName
params.description: The name of the subcookie to retrieve.

params.name: converter
params.description:
(Optional) A function to run on the value before returning
it. The function is not used if the cookie doesn't exist.

return.description: The formatted cookie string.

_createCookieString.description: Creates a cookie string that can be assigned into document.cookie.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the cookie.

params.description: The value of the cookie.

params.name: encodeValue
params.description: True to encode the value, false to leave as-is.

params.name: options
params.description: (Optional) Options for the cookie.

preventOverlap.description:

constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping 
the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment
for corner based alignments

constrain.description:
The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be
set to true, to constrain to the viewport.

_bindUIPosConstrained.description:
Binds event listeners responsible for updating the UI state in response to Widget constrained positioning related state changes.

This method is invoked after bindUI is invoked for the Widget class using YUI's aop infrastructure.

params.name: e
params.description: The event facade for the attribute change

_constrainOnXYChange.description:
The on change listener for the "xy" attribute. Modifies the event facade's
newVal property with the constrained XY value.

params.name: e
params.description: The event facade

_afterConstrainChange.description:
After change listener for the "constrain" attribute, responsible
for updating the UI, in response to attribute changes.

params.name: enable
params.description: Enable or disable constraints

enable or disable constraints listeners.description:
Updates the UI if enabling constraints, and sets up the xyChange event listeners
to constrain whenever the widget is moved. Disabling constraints removes the listeners.

params.name: node
params.description: Optional.

_getRegion.description:
Utility method to normalize region retrieval from a node instance, 
or the viewport, if no node is provided.

params.name: val
params.description: The attribute value

_setConstrain.description: The setter implementation for the "constrain" attribute.

params.name: xy
params.description: Optional. The xy values to constrain

params.name: node
params.description: Optional. The node to constrain to, or true for the viewport

constrain.description:
Constrains the widget's bounding box to a node (or the viewport). If xy or node are not 
passed in, the current position and the value of "constrain" will be used respectively.
The widget's position will be changed to the constrained position.

return.description: The constrained value

_constrain.description:
The method which performs the actual constrain calculations for a given axis ("x" or "y") based
on the regions provided.

params.name: val
params.description: The value to constrain

params.name: axis
params.description: The axis to use for constrainment

params.name: nodeRegion
params.description: The region of the node to constrain

params.name: constrainingRegion
params.description: The region of the node (or viewport) to constrain to

return.description: The constrained xy values

params.name: xy
params.description: The xy values to constrain

params.name: node
params.description: Optional. The node to constrain to, or true for the viewport

getConstrainedXY.description:
Calculates the constrained positions for the XY positions provided, using
the provided node argument is passed in. If no node value is passed in, the value of 
the "constrain" attribute is used.

return.description: The constrained value

_preventOverlap.description:
The method which performs the preventOverlap calculations for a given axis ("x" or "y") based
on the value and regions provided.

params.name: val
params.description: The value being constrain

params.name: axis
params.description: The axis to being constrained

params.name: nodeRegion
params.description: The region of the node being constrained

params.name: constrainingRegion
params.description: The region of the node (or viewport) we need to constrain to

WidgetPositionConstrain._PREVENT_OVERLAP.description:
The set of positions for which to prevent
overlap.

WidgetPositionConstrain.ATTRS.description:
Static property used to define the default attribute 
configuration introduced by WidgetPositionConstrain.

WidgetPositionConstrain.description: A widget extension, which can be used to add constrained xy positioning support to the base Widget class, through the Base.build method. This extension requires that the WidgetPosition extension be added to the Widget (before WidgetPositionConstrain, if part of the same extension list passed to Base.build).

Lang.name: Lang

return.description: true if o is an array.

isArray.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is an array. Returns false for array-like collections such as the function arguments collection or HTMLElement collection will return false. Use Y.Array.test if you want to test for an array-like collection.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: the trimmed string.

trim.description:
Returns a string without any leading or trailing whitespace.  If
the input is not a string, the input will be returned untouched.

params.name: s
params.description: the string to trim.

return.description: true if o is a date.

isDate.description: Determines whether or not the supplied item is a date instance.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: true if o is a string.

isString.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a string.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: true if o is a boolean.

isBoolean.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a boolean.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: the trimmed string.

trimLeft.description: Returns a string without any leading whitespace.

params.name: s
params.description: the string to trim.

return.description: the substitute result.

sub.description: Lightweight version of Y.substitute. Uses the same template structure as Y.substitute, but doesn't support recursion, auto-object coersion, or formats.

params.name: s
params.description: String to be modified.

params.name: o
params.description: Object containing replacement values.

return.description: the trimmed string.

trimRight.description: Returns a string without any trailing whitespace.

params.name: s
params.description: the string to trim.

return.description: true if o is null.

isNull.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is null.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: true if it is not null/undefined/NaN || false.

isValue.description:
A convenience method for detecting a legitimate non-null value.
Returns false for null/undefined/NaN, true for other values,
including 0/false/''

params.name: o
params.description: The item to test.

return.description: the current date

now.description: Returns the current time in milliseconds.

return.description: true if o is a function.

isFunction.description:
Determines whether or not the provided item is a function. Note: Internet Explorer thinks certain functions are objects: 

var obj = document.createElement("object");
Y.Lang.isFunction(obj.getAttribute) // reports false in IE
 
var input = document.createElement("input"); // append to body
Y.Lang.isFunction(input.focus) // reports false in IE

You will have to implement additional tests if these functions matter to you.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: true if o is a number.

isNumber.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is a legal number.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

return.description: the detected type.

type.description:
Returns a string representing the type of the item passed in.

Known issues:

  • typeof HTMLElementCollection returns function in Safari, but Y.type() reports object, which could be a good thing -- but it actually caused the logic in Y.Lang.isObject to fail.

params.name: o
params.description: the item to test.

return.description: true if o is an object.

isObject.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is of type object or function. Note that arrays are also objects, so Y.Lang.isObject([]) === true.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

params.name: failfn
params.description: fail if the input is a function.

return.description: true if o is undefined.

isUndefined.description: Determines whether or not the provided item is undefined.

params.name: o
params.description: The object to test.

Lang.description: Provides the language utilites and extensions used by the library

DD.Drag.name: DD.Drag

node.description: Y.Node instance to use as the element to initiate a drag operation

activeHandle.description: This config option is set by Drag to inform you of which handle fired the drag event (in the case that there are several handles): default false.

dragNode.description: Y.Node instance to use as the draggable element, defaults to node

move.description: If this is false, the drag element will not move with the cursor: default true. Can be used to "resize" the element.

target.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module has been loaded. It will make this node a drop target as well as draggable.

startCentered.description: Center the dragNode to the mouse position on drag:start: default false

offsetNode.description: Offset the drag element by the difference in cursor position: default true

handles.description: Array of valid handles to add. Adding something here will set all handles, even if previously added with addHandle

haltDown.description: Should the mousedown event be halted. Default: true

clickPixelThresh.description: The number of pixels to move to start a drag operation, default is 3.

bubbles.description: Controls the default bubble parent for this Drag instance. Default: Y.DD.DDM. Set to false to disable bubbling. Use bubbleTargets in config

groups.description: Array of groups to add this drag into.

lock.description: Set to lock this drag element so that it can't be dragged: default false.

dragMode.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module is active. It will set the dragMode (point, intersect, strict) of this Drag instance.

useShim.description: Use the protective shim on all drag operations: default true. Only works with dd-ddm, not dd-ddm-base.

dragging.description: This attribute is not meant to be used by the implementor, it is meant to be used as an Event tracker so you can listen for it to change.

data.description: A payload holder to store arbitrary data about this drag object, can be used to store any value.

primaryButtonOnly.description: By default a drag operation will only begin if the mousedown occurred with the primary mouse button. Setting this to false will allow for all mousedown events to trigger a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description: The number of milliseconds a mousedown has to pass to start a drag operation, default is 1000.

constructors.description: Provides the ability to drag a Node.

START_EVENT.description: This property defaults to "mousedown", but when drag-gestures is loaded, it is changed to "gesturemovestart"

_fromTimeout.description: Flag to determine if the drag operation came from a timeout

_handles.description: A private hash of the valid drag handles

_ieSelectBack.description: We will hold a copy of the current "onselectstart" method on this property, and reset it after we are done using it.

_invalidsDefault.description: A private hash of the default invalid selector strings: {'textarea': true, 'input': true, 'a': true, 'button': true, 'select': true}

lastXY.description: The position of the element as it's moving (for offset calculations)

_groups.description: Storage Array for the groups this drag belongs to.

_ev_md.description: A private reference to the mousedown DOM event

_bubbleTargets.description: The default bubbleTarget for this object. Default: Y.DD.DDM

_startTime.description: The getTime of the mousedown event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_endTime.description: The getTime of the mouseup event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_dragThreshMet.description: Private flag to see if the drag threshhold was met

actXY.description: The xy that the node will be set to. Changing this will alter the position as it's dragged.

realXY.description: The real xy position of the node.

deltaXY.description: The offset of the mouse position to the element's position

_invalids.description: A private hash of the invalid selector strings

target.description: This will be a reference to the Drop instance associated with this drag if the target: true config attribute is set..

mouseXY.description: The XY coords of the mousemove

region.description: A region object associated with this drag, used for checking regions while dragging.

addToGroup.description: Add this Drag instance to a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group additions.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to add this Drag Instance to.

params.name: xy
params.description: The XY coords to set the position to.

_setStartPosition.description: Sets the current position of the Element and calculates the offset

_fixDragStart.description: The function we use as the ondragstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer. This keeps IE from blowing up on images as drag handles.

params.name: ev
params.description: The drag:drag event

_defDragFn.description: Default function for drag:drag. Fired from _moveNode.

stopDrag.description: Method will forcefully stop a drag operation. For example calling this from inside an ESC keypress handler will stop this drag.

params.name: ev
params.description: The mousemove DOM event

validClick.description: Method first checks to see if we have handles, if so it validates the click against the handle. Then if it finds a valid handle, it checks it against the invalid handles list. Returns true if a good handle was used, false otherwise.

removeInvalid.description: Remove an invalid handle added by addInvalid

params.name: str
params.description: The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

addHandle.description: Add a handle to a drag element. Drag only initiates when a mousedown happens on this element.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

removeHandle.description: Remove a Selector added by addHandle

params.name: str
params.description: The selector for the handle to be removed.

_handleMouseDownEvent.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_moveNode.description: This method performs the actual element move.

destructor.description: Lifecycle destructor, unreg the drag from the DDM and remove listeners

_ieSelectFix.description: The function we use as the onselectstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer

params.name: e
params.description: The drag:align event.

_defAlignFn.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.

_createEvents.description: This method creates all the events for this Event Target and publishes them so we get Event Bubbling.

_timeoutCheck.description: The method passed to setTimeout to determine if the clickTimeThreshold was met.

removeFromGroup.description: Remove this Drag instance from a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group removals.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

_fixIEMouseUp.description: This method copies the _ieSelectFix property back to the onselectstart listner on the document.

_defEndFn.description: Handler for fixing the selection in IE

params.name: eXY
params.description: The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

_alignNode.description: This method performs the alignment before the element move.

_prevEndFn.description: Handler for preventing the drag:end event. It will reset the node back to it's start position

_prep.description: Attach event listners and add classname

addInvalid.description: Add a selector string to test the handle against. If the test passes the drag operation will not continue.

params.name: str
params.description: The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

_defMouseDownFn.description: Handler for the mousedown DOM event

_handleMouseUp.description: Handler for the mouseup DOM event

params.name: xy
params.description: The xy coords to align with.

_align.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.

_handleTarget.description: Attribute handler for the target config attribute.

_unprep.description: Detach event listeners and remove classname

_fixIEMouseDown.description: This method copies the onselectstart listner on the document to the _ieSelectFix property

return.description: A Date, or null.

params.name: data
params.description: Data to convert. Values supported by the Date constructor are supported.

params.name: x
params.description: The number to be padded

params.name: pad
params.description: The character to pad the number with

params.name: r
params.description: (optional) The base of the pad, eg, 10 implies to two digits, 100 implies to 3 digits.

xPad.description: Pad a number with leading spaces, zeroes or something else

return.description: Formatted date for display.

params.name: oDate
params.description: Date.

params.type:
Object} (Optional) Object literal of configuration values:
format {String} (Optional)

Any strftime string is supported, such as "%I:%M:%S %p". strftime has several format specifiers defined by the Open group at http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/strftime.html PHP added a few of its own, defined at http://www.php.net/strftime

This javascript implementation supports all the PHP specifiers and a few more. The full list is below.

If not specified, it defaults to the ISO 8601 standard date format: %Y-%m-%d. This may be overridden by the deprecated Y.config.dateFormat property.

%a
abbreviated weekday name according to the current locale
%A
full weekday name according to the current locale
%b
abbreviated month name according to the current locale
%B
full month name according to the current locale
%c
preferred date and time representation for the current locale
%C
century number (the year divided by 100 and truncated to an integer, range 00 to 99)
%d
day of the month as a decimal number (range 01 to 31)
%D
same as %m/%d/%y
%e
day of the month as a decimal number, a single digit is preceded by a space (range " 1" to "31")
%F
same as %Y-%m-%d (ISO 8601 date format)
%g
like %G, but without the century
%G
The 4-digit year corresponding to the ISO week number
%h
same as %b
%H
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 00 to 23)
%I
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 01 to 12)
%j
day of the year as a decimal number (range 001 to 366)
%k
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 0 to 23); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %H.)
%l
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 1 to 12); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %I.)
%m
month as a decimal number (range 01 to 12)
%M
minute as a decimal number
%n
newline character
%p
either "AM" or "PM" according to the given time value, or the corresponding strings for the current locale
%P
like %p, but lower case
%r
time in a.m. and p.m. notation equal to %I:%M:%S %p
%R
time in 24 hour notation equal to %H:%M
%s
number of seconds since the Epoch, ie, since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC
%S
second as a decimal number
%t
tab character
%T
current time, equal to %H:%M:%S
%u
weekday as a decimal number [1,7], with 1 representing Monday
%U
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Sunday as the first day of the first week
%V
The ISO 8601:1988 week number of the current year as a decimal number, range 01 to 53, where week 1 is the first week that has at least 4 days in the current year, and with Monday as the first day of the week.
%w
day of the week as a decimal, Sunday being 0
%W
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Monday as the first day of the first week
%x
preferred date representation for the current locale without the time
%X
preferred time representation for the current locale without the date
%y
year as a decimal number without a century (range 00 to 99)
%Y
year as a decimal number including the century
%z
numerical time zone representation
%Z
time zone name or abbreviation
%%
a literal "%" character
locale {String
params.name: oConfig
params.description:
(Deprecated, optional)
Deprecated - use Y.config.lang instead, which provides access to a much larger set of built-in languages. The locale to use when displaying days of week, months of the year, and other locale specific strings. If not specified, this defaults to "en" (though this may be overridden by the deprecated Y.config.locale). The following locales are built in:
en
English
en-US
US English
en-GB
British English
en-AU
Australian English (identical to British English)
More locales may be added by subclassing of the deprecated Y.DataType.Date.Locale["en"]. See Y.DataType.Date.Locale for more information.

AsyncQueue.name: AsyncQueue

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks to seed the queue

constructors.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

complete.description: Event fired after the last queued callback is executed.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

_defRemoveFn.description:
Default functionality for the "remove" event. Removes the callback from the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

pause.description:
Pause the execution of the queue after the execution of the current
callback completes.  If called from code outside of a queued callback,
clears the timeout for the pending callback. Paused queue can be
restarted with q.run()

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

run.description:
Sets the queue in motion.  All queued callbacks will be executed in
order unless pause() or stop() is called or if one of the callbacks is
configured with autoContinue: false.

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_schedule.description: Schedules the execution of asynchronous callbacks.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

params.name: e
params.description: The event object

_defShiftFn.description: Default functionality for the "shift" event. Shifts the callback stored in the event object's callback property from the queue if it is the first item.

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_execute.description:
Handles the execution of callbacks. Returns a boolean indicating
whether it is appropriate to continue running.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

stop.description:
Stop and clear the queue after the current execution of the
current callback completes.

_init.description: Initializes the AsyncQueue instance properties and events.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

remove.description:
Removes the callback from the queue.  If the queue is active, the
removal is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

return.description: the callback to execute

next.description:
Returns the next callback needing execution.  If a callback is
configured to repeat via iterations or until, it will be returned until
the completion criteria is met.
When the queue is empty, null is returned.

return.description: index of the callback or -1 if not found

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback or its specified id

indexOf.description:
Returns the current index of a callback.  Pass in either the id or
callback function from getCallback.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

add.description:
Add any number of callbacks to the end of the queue. Callbacks may be
provided as functions or objects.

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

_defExecFn.description:
Default functionality for the "execute" event.  Executes the
callback function

return.description: the callback object

params.name: id
params.description: the id assigned to the callback

getCallback.description:
Retrieve a callback by its id.  Useful to modify the configuration
while the queue is running.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

_defPromoteFn.description:
Default functionality for the "promote" event. Promotes the named callback to the head of the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

return.description: a decorated function wrapper to execute the callback

_prepare.description:
Creates a wrapper function to execute the callback using the aggregated 
configuration generated by combining the static AsyncQueue.defaults, the
instance defaults, and the specified callback settings.
The wrapper function is decorated with the callback configuration as
properties for runtime modification.

params.name: callback
params.description: the raw callback

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

promote.description:
Promotes the named callback to the top of the queue. If a callback is
currently executing or looping (via until or iterations), the promotion
is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

_defAddFn.description: Default functionality for the "add" event. Adds the callbacks in the event facade to the queue. Callbacks successfully added to the queue are present in the event's added property in the after phase.

return.description:
true if queue is waiting for a 
from any initiated transactions

isRunning.description: Determines if the queue is waiting for a callback to complete execution.

size.description: Returns the number of callbacks in the queue.

AsyncQueue.defaults.description:
Static default values used to populate callback configuration properties. Preconfigured defaults include:

  • autoContinue: true
  • iterations: 1
  • timeout: 10 (10ms between callbacks)
  • until: (function to run until iterations <= 0)

_running.type:
{Boolean|Object} true for synchronous callback execution, the
return handle from Y.later for async callbacks.
Otherwise false.
_running.description: Used to indicate the queue is currently executing a callback.

defaults.description:
Callback defaults for this instance.  Static defaults that are not
overridden are also included.

AsyncQueue.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

Y.one('#my-input').plug(Y.Plugin.AutoComplete, {

});

return.description: A reference to the host object

plug.description:
Adds a plugin to the host object. This will instantiate the 
plugin and attach it to the configured namespace on the host object.

params.name: P
params.description:
Accepts the plugin class, or an object with a "fn" property specifying the plugin class and a "cfg" property specifying the configuration for the Plugin.

Additionally an Array can also be passed in, with the above function or object values, allowing the user to add multiple plugins in a single call.

params.name: config
params.description:
(Optional) If the first argument is the plugin class, the second argument
can be the configuration for the plugin.

return.description: returns true, if the plugin has been plugged into this host, false otherwise.

hasPlugin.description: Determines if a plugin has plugged into this host.

_destroyPlugins.description: Unplugs and destroys all plugins on the host

return.description: A reference to the host object

unplug.description:
Removes a plugin from the host object. This will destroy the 
plugin instance and delete the namepsace from the host object.

params.name: plugin

The namespace of the plugin, or the plugin class with the static NS namespace property defined. If not provided,
all registered plugins are unplugged.

params.name: hostClass
params.description: The host class from which to unregister the plugins

params.name: plugin
params.description: The plugin class, or an array of plugin classes

Unregisters any class level plugins which have been registered by the host class, or any
other class in the hierarchy.

Plugin.Host.plug.description:
Registers plugins to be instantiated at the class level (plugins 
which should be plugged into every instance of the class by default).

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object with property name/value pairs.

_initPlugins.description:
Initializes static plugins registered on the host (using the
Base.plug static method) and any plugins passed to the 
instance through the "plugins" configuration property.

PluginHost.description: Constructor and static configuration support for plugins

Plugin.Host.description:
An augmentable class, which provides the augmented class with the ability to host plugins. It adds plug and unplug methods to the augmented class, which can be used to add or remove plugins from instances of the class.

Plugins can also be added through the constructor configuration object passed to the host class' constructor using the "plugins" property. Supported values for the "plugins" property are those defined by the plug method. For example the following code would add the AnimPlugin and IOPlugin to Overlay (the plugin host):

var o = new Overlay({plugins: [ AnimPlugin, {fn:IOPlugin, cfg:{section:"header"}}]});

Plug.Host's protected _initPlugins and _destroyPlugins methods should be invoked by the host class at the appropriate point in the host's lifecyle.

get.description:
Gets the module's localized resources for the currently active language (as provided by the getLang method).

Optionally, the localized resources for alternate languages which have been added to Intl (see the add method) can be retrieved by providing the BCP 47 language tag as the lang parameter.

return.description:
The available language that best matches the
preferred language list, or "".

lookupBestLang.description:
Returns the language among those available that
best matches the preferred language list, using the Lookup
algorithm of BCP 47.
If none of the available languages meets the user's preferences,
then "" is returned.
Extended language ranges are not supported.

params.name: preferredLanguages
params.description:
The list of preferred
languages in descending preference order, represented as BCP 47
language tags. A string array or a comma-separated list.

params.name: availableLanguages
params.description:
The list of languages
that the application supports, represented as BCP 47 language
tags.

return.description: Hash table containing references to the new Document & Window

_create.description: Create the iframe or Window and get references to the Document & Window

_setLinkedCSS.description: Set's the linked CSS on the instance..

_DOMPaste.description: Simple pass thru handler for the paste event so we can do content cleanup

return.description: The internal YUI instance

getInstance.description: Get a reference to the internal YUI instance.

_fixIECursors.description:
It appears that having a BR tag anywhere in the source "below" a table with a percentage width (in IE 7 & 8) if there is any TEXTINPUT's outside the iframe, the cursor will rapidly flickr and the CPU would occasionally spike. This method finds all
's below the sourceIndex of the first table. Does some checks to see if they can be modified and replaces then with a so the layout will remain in tact, but the flickering will no longer happen.

_setHTML.description: Set the content of the iframe

params.name: html

_onContentReady.description:
Called once the content is available in the frame/window and calls the final use call
on the internal instance so that the modules are loaded properly.

render.description: Render the iframe into the container config option or open the window.

use.description:
This is a scoped version of the normal YUI.use method & is bound to this frame/window.
At setup, the inst.use method is mapped to this method.

Called from the first YUI instance that sets up the internal instance.
This loads the content into the window/frame and attaches the contentready event.

_resolveBaseHref.description: Resolves the basehref of the page the frame is created on. Only applies to dynamic content.

_setExtraCSS.description: Set's the extra CSS on the instance..

_handleFocus.description: Does some tricks on focus to set the proper cursor position.

params.description: The type of event to listen for

params.description: The method to attach

delegate.description: A delegate method passed to the instance's delegate method

_defReadyFn.description: Binds DOM events, sets the iframe to visible and fires the ready event

return.description: Object hash of window and document references, if a YUI config was passed, it is returned.

_resolveWinDoc.description: Resolves the document and window from an iframe or window instance

params.name: c
params.description: The YUI Config to add the window and document to

_getHTML.description: Get the content from the iframe

params.name: html
params.description: The raw HTML from the body of the iframe.

_onDomEvent.description:
Generic handler for all DOM events fired by the iframe or window. This handler
takes the current EventFacade and augments it to fire on the Frame host. It adds two new properties
to the EventFacade called frameX and frameY which adds the scroll and xy position of the iframe
to the original pageX and pageY of the event so external nodes can be positioned over the frame.

META.description: The meta-tag for Content-Type to add to the dynamic document

_instance.description: Internal reference to the YUI instance bound to the iFrame or window

_rendered.description: Internal reference set when render is called.

_ready.description: Internal reference set when the content is ready.

HTML.description: The template string used to create the iframe

_iframe.description: Internal Node reference to the iFrame or the window

DOM_EVENTS.description: The DomEvents that the frame automatically attaches and bubbles

DEFAULT_CSS.description: The default css used when creating the document.

PAGE_HTML.description: The template used to create the page when created dynamically.

Frame.description:
Creates a wrapper around an iframe. It loads the content either from a local
file or from script and creates a local YUI instance bound to that new window and document.

StyleSheet.name: StyleSheet

params.name: seed
params.description:
a style or link node, its id, or a
name or guid of a StyleSheet, or a string of css text

params.name: name
params.description:
(optional) name to register instance for future static
access

constructors.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

enable.description: Enable all the rules in the sheet

StyleSheet.isValidSelector.description:
Determines if a selector string is safe to use. Used internally in set to prevent IE from locking up when attempting to add a rule for a "bad selector".

Bad selectors are considered to be any string containing unescaped `~!@$%^&()+=|{}[];'"?< or space. Also forbidden are . or # followed by anything other than an alphanumeric. Additionally -abc or .-abc or #_abc or '# ' all fail. There are likely more failure cases, so please file a bug if you encounter one.

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string

params.name: sel
params.description: Selector string

getCssText.description:
Get the current cssText for a rule or the entire sheet.  If the
selector param is supplied, only the cssText for that rule will be
returned, if found.  If the selector string targets multiple
selectors separated by commas, the cssText of the first rule only
will be returned.  If no selector string, the stylesheet's full
cssText will be returned.

isEnabled.description: Returns false if the StyleSheet is disabled.  Otherwise true.

disable.description:
Disable all the rules in the sheet.  Rules may be changed while the
StyleSheet is disabled.

set.description:
Set style properties for a provided selector string. If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If the selector string does not have a corresponding rule in the sheet, it will be added.

The object properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript names of style properties. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be set by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: Object literal of style properties and new values

return.description: the static id

getId.description: Get the unique stamp for this StyleSheet instance

return.description:
false if no name or sheet is not a StyleSheet
instance. true otherwise.

StyleSheet.register.description: Registers a StyleSheet instance in the static registry by the given name

params.name: name
params.description: the name to assign the StyleSheet in the registry

params.name: sheet
params.description: The StyleSheet instance

unset.description:
Unset style properties for a provided selector string, removing their effect from the style cascade.

If the selector includes commas, it will be split into individual selectors and applied accordingly. If there are no properties remaining in the rule after unsetting, the rule is removed.

The style property or properties in the second parameter must be the JavaScript style property names. E.g. fontSize rather than font-size.

The float style property will be unset by any of "float", "styleFloat", or "cssFloat".

params.name: sel
params.description: the selector string to apply the changes to

params.name: css
params.description: style property name or Array of names

return.description: the resulting cssText string

StyleSheet.toCssText.description:
Converts an object literal of style properties and values into a string of css text. This can then be assigned to el.style.cssText.

The optional second parameter is a cssText string representing the starting state of the style prior to alterations. This is most often extracted from the eventual target's current el.style.cssText.

params.name: css
params.description: object literal of style properties and values

params.name: cssText
params.description: (optional) starting cssText value

StyleSheet.description:
Create an instance of StyleSheet to encapsulate a css stylesheet. The constructor can be called using function or constructor syntax. 
var sheet = Y.StyleSheet(..);
or 
var sheet = new Y.StyleSheet(..);
The first parameter passed can be any of the following things:
  • The desired string name to register a new empty sheet
  • The string name of an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The unique guid generated for an existing StyleSheet instance
  • The id of an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The node reference for an existing <link> or <style> node
  • The Y.Node instance wrapping an existing <link> or <style> node
  • A chunk of css text to create a new stylesheet from

If a string is passed, StyleSheet will first look in its static name registry for an existing sheet, then in the DOM for an element with that id. If neither are found and the string contains the { character, it will be used as a the initial cssText for a new StyleSheet. Otherwise, a new empty StyleSheet is created, assigned the string value as a name, and registered statically by that name.

The optional second parameter is a string name to register the sheet as. This param is largely useful when providing a node id/ref or chunk of css text to create a populated instance.

params.name: val
params.description: true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

_uiSetVisible.description:
The original Widget _uiSetVisible implementation. This currently needs to be replicated,
so it can be invoked before or after the animation starts or stops, since the original
methods is not available to the AOP implementation.

params.name: val
params.description: true, if making the widget visible. false, if hiding it.

_uiAnimSetVisible.description:
The injected method used to override the host widget's _uiSetVisible implementation with an animated version of the same.

This method replaces the default _uiSetVisible handler Widget provides, by injecting itself before _uiSetVisible, and preventing the default behavior.

_bindAnimHide.description: Binds a listener to invoke the original visibility handling when the animHide animation is complete

params.name: config

initializer.description:

visibililty implementation to add animation.

destructor.description:

animation instances.

_bindAnimShow.description: Binds a listener to invoke the original visibility handling when the animShow animation is started

WidgetAnim.NS.description:

reference the plugin instance, when it's plugged in.

Plugin.WidgetAnim.description: A plugin class which can be used to animate widget visibility changes.

AutoCompleteList.name: AutoCompleteList

activeItem.description:
Item that's currently active, if any. When the user presses enter,
this is the item that will be selected.

activateFirstItem.description: If true, the first item in the list will be activated by default when the list is initially displayed and when results change.

listNode.description: Node that will contain result items.

scrollIntoView.description: If true, the viewport will be scrolled to ensure that the active list item is visible when necessary.

alwaysShowList.description: If true, the list will remain visible even when there are no results to display.

tabSelect.description: If true, pressing the tab key while the list is visible will select the active item, if any.

hoveredItem.description: Item currently being hovered over by the mouse, if any.

strings.description: Translatable strings used by the AutoCompleteList widget.

circular.description: If true, keyboard navigation will wrap around to the opposite end of the list when navigating past the first or last item.

select.description:
Fires when an autocomplete suggestion is selected from the list by
a keyboard action or mouse click.

_keyUp.description: Called when the up arrow key is pressed.

_keyDown.description: Called when the down arrow key is pressed.

return.description: Added nodes.

_add.description: Appends the specified result items to the list inside a new item node.

params.name: items
params.description:
Result item or array of
result items.

_getFirstItemNode.description: Gets the first item node in the list, or null if the list is empty.

return.description: ARIA node.

_createAriaNode.description: Creates and returns an ARIA live region node.

hide.description: Hides the list, unless the alwaysShowList attribute is true.

_onItemClick.description: Delegated event handler for item click events.

params.name: results
params.description: (optional) Results.

_syncResults.description: Synchronizes the results displayed in the list with those in the results argument, or with the results attribute if an argument is not provided.

_clear.description: Clears the contents of the tray.

return.description: Item node.

_createItemNode.description: Creates and returns an item node with the specified content.

params.name: result

_activatePrevItem.description: Activates the item previous to the currently active item. If there is no previous item and the circular attribute is true, focus will wrap back to the input node.

_keyTab.description: Called when the tab key is pressed.

_getLastItemNode.description: Gets the last item node in the list, or null if the list is empty.

params.name: visible

params.name: itemNode

selectItem.description: Selects the specified itemNode, or the current activeItem if itemNode is not specified.

params.name: subs
params.description:
(optional) Substitutions for placeholders in the
string.

_ariaSay.description: Updates the ARIA live region with the specified message.

_activateNextItem.description: Activates the next item after the currently active item. If there is no next item and the circular attribute is true, focus will wrap back to the input node.

return.description: List node.

_createListNode.description: Creates and returns a list node.

_keyEsc.description: Called when the escape key is pressed.

Assert.Error.name: Assert.Error

params.name: message
params.description: The message to display when the error occurs.

constructors.description:
Error is thrown whenever an assertion fails. It provides methods
to more easily get at error information and also provides a base class
from which more specific assertion errors can be derived.

return.description: A primitive value version of the error.

valueOf.description: Returns a primitive value version of the error. Same as toString().

return.description: A string describing the error.

getMessage.description:
Returns a fully formatted error for an assertion failure. This should
be overridden by all subclasses to provide specific information.

return.description: A string representation of the error.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the error.

name.description: The name of the error that occurred.

Assert.Error.description:
Error is thrown whenever an assertion fails. It provides methods
to more easily get at error information and also provides a base class
from which more specific assertion errors can be derived.

ArrayList~filter.name: ArrayList~filter

return.description: New instance based on who passed the validator.

params.name: validator
params.description: Boolean function to determine in or out.

filter.description:
Create a new ArrayList (or augmenting class instance) from a subset of items as determined by the boolean function passed as the argument. The original ArrayList is unchanged.

The validator signature is validator( item ).

ArrayList~filter.description: Adds filter method to ArrayList prototype

YUI~substitute.name: YUI~substitute

return.description: the substituted string.

params.name: s
params.description: The string that will be modified.

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the replacement values.

params.name: f
params.description:
An optional function that can be used to
process each match.  It receives the key,
value, and any extra metadata included with
the key inside of the braces.

params.name: recurse

substitute.description:
Does variable substitution on a string. It scans through the string
looking for expressions enclosed in { } braces. If an expression
is found, it is used a key on the object.  If there is a space in
the key, the first word is used for the key and the rest is provided
to an optional function to be used to programatically determine the
value (the extra information might be used for this decision). If
the value for the key in the object, or what is returned from the
function has a string value, number value, or object value, it is
substituted for the bracket expression and it repeats.  If this
value is an object, it uses the Object's toString() if this has
been overridden, otherwise it does a shallow dump of the key/value
pairs if Y.dump is available (if dump isn't available, toString()
is used).
This method is included in the 'substitute' module.  It is not included
in the YUI module.

YUI~substitute.description: The following methods are added to the YUI instance

_scrollTimer.description: Holder for the Timer object returned from Y.later.

_scrolling.description: Tells if we are actively scrolling or not.

thumb-x.png or thumb-y.png in the sam skin directory of the
current build path for Slider

Path to the thumb image.  This will be used as both the thumb and
shadow as a sprite.  Defaults at render() to thumb-x.png or
thumb-y.png in the skin directory of the current skin.

Axis upon which the Slider's thumb moves.  "x" for
horizontal, "y" for vertical.
